channel.title: youtube on Sparrow10
channel.description: Recent content in youtube on Sparrow10

item.title: The Power of Akka
item.description: In this short video, the people of Lightbend shows some features of Akka that help to build cloud applications capable of self-healing and scalling.

item.title: Why is Kafka fast? (by Sahn Lam)
item.description: Apache Kafka is a central piece for a lot of data architectures. One of Kafka’s key features is velocity, in addition to the publish-subscribe pattern, logs, and more. This video shows what people mean when they say Kafka is fast, and how it is accomplished.

item.title: The "M" word (Monads)
item.description: When you start with functional programming, saying the M word is like swearing. This esoteric, strange, and uncommon word points to a general pattern that takes some time to grasp. Despite saying that a monad is a monoid in the category of endofunctors is accurate, for a newbie is as unhelpful as comparing monads with burritos. It just misses the point. Here are some videos I found valuable for understanding this concept with a practical approach.

item.title: The Actor Model
item.description: I love this conversation between Carl Hewitt, Clemens Szyperski, and Erik Meijer, describing the Actor Model. It is a very interesting concurrency model that use an abstraction called actor as the fundamental unit of computation (embodying processing, storage, and communications). I would like to learn more about actors and how to use them with akka. This is maybe the most famous quote about the Actor Model. “One actor is no actor, they come in systems” See you next time.

item.title: Why Scala?
item.description: In this video, Adam Warski from SoftwareMill talks about some Scala features that make it great for business applications.

item.title: The Expanse
item.description: Not so long ago, I realized that I became a fan of sci-fi and fantasy. After watching the Game of Thrones TV show, I jumped into the books, and it was a great experience. Not so nerd to be an ASOIF expert, it was for me a new experience to live through the eyes of those characters what was happening in their world. Sometime later, when I watched a teaser of The Expanse on Amazon Prime Video, it was obvious to me that it will be my next sci-fi adventure.
